content.description: Let f be a function that has derivatives of all orders for all real numbers. Assume f (1)=3, f ′ (1) =−2, f ″(1)= 2 and f ‴ (1)=4
content.question: Write the third-degree Taylor polynomial for f aboutx=1 and use it to approximate f(1.2) .

frqParts.text: Write the third-degree Taylor polynomial for f aboutx=1 and use it to approximate f(1.2) .

topic.text: 10.11: (BC ONLY) Finding Taylor Polynomial Approximations of Functions

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Identify a re-expression of mathematical information presented in a given representation
